intro: Kopsia schultzii var. stricta, commonly known as the narrowleaf kopsia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
